items.prompt: The monthly payment made to an insurance company is called a ________.
items.explanation: A premium is the amount of money an individual or business pays for an insurance policy.

items.prompt: When an accident occurs, the policyholder files a ________ to request compensation.
items.explanation: A claim is a formal request to an insurance company asking for a payment based on the terms of the insurance policy.

items.prompt: The risk of the new project ________ by the underwriting department.
items.explanation: Passive voice is used to show the process: 'is evaluated'.

items.prompt: An ________ is a professional who uses statistics to calculate insurance risks and premiums.
items.explanation: Actuaries analyze the financial costs of risk and uncertainty.

items.prompt: The ________ is the amount the insured must pay out of pocket before the insurance covers the rest.
items.explanation: A deductible (or excess) is the fixed amount you pay towards a claim.

items.prompt: Last year, thousands of claims ________ due to fraudulent activity.
items.explanation: Past passive: 'were rejected' (plural).

items.prompt: Insurance ________ is the process of evaluating a risk to decide whether to provide coverage.
items.explanation: Underwriting involves assessing the eligibility of a customer to receive an insurance policy.

items.prompt: New policies ________ by the legal team every quarter.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'are reviewed' (plural).

items.prompt: The ________ is the person or entity that owns the insurance policy.
items.explanation: A policyholder is the person who pays the premium and owns the policy.

items.prompt: Third-party ________ insurance is mandatory for all drivers in this country.
items.explanation: Liability insurance protects against claims resulting from injuries and damage to people and/or property.

items.prompt: The claim ________ by the adjuster yesterday morning.
items.explanation: Past passive: 'was approved' (singular).

items.prompt: If you choose a higher ________, your monthly premium will usually be lower.
items.explanation: A higher deductible reduces the insurer's risk, leading to lower premiums.

items.prompt: Actuarial tables ________ to predict life expectancy and mortality rates.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'are used' (plural).

items.prompt: The ________ process can take several weeks for complex commercial risks.
items.explanation: Underwriting involves detailed risk assessment.

items.prompt: All information ________ by the applicant must be accurate and complete.
items.explanation: In this context, 'provided' acts as a past participle in a reduced relative clause (which is provided).

items.prompt: Life insurance ________ are often paid out to the beneficiaries after the policyholder's death.
items.explanation: Benefits (or death benefits) are the payments made by the insurance company.

items.prompt: The insurance market ________ by a few large multinational corporations.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'is dominated'.

items.prompt: A ________ is an addition to a standard insurance policy that provides extra coverage.
items.explanation: An insurance rider (or endorsement) adds specific coverage to a policy.

items.prompt: In most cases, the premium ________ annually or semi-annually.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'is paid'.

items.prompt: The total amount of ________ is the maximum sum the insurance company will pay.
items.explanation: Coverage refers to the amount of protection or the limit of the policy.

items.prompt: Fill in the blank with the correct passive form: The risks [are calculated] by expert actuaries.
items.text: The risks [are calculated] by expert actuaries.
items.explanation: Passive voice: be + past participle.

items.prompt: Fill in the blank: The insurance [premium] is the amount you pay for coverage.
items.text: The insurance [premium] is the amount you pay for coverage.
items.explanation: Premium is the standard term for the cost of insurance.

items.prompt: Reinsurance ________ by primary insurers to transfer some of their risk to another company.
items.explanation: Reinsurance is insurance for insurance companies.

items.prompt: The policy ________ if the premium is not paid within the grace period.
items.explanation: Future passive: 'will be canceled'.

items.prompt: An insurance ________ acts as an intermediary between the client and the insurance company.
items.explanation: Brokers represent the interests of the clients.

items.prompt: The damage to the building ________ by a professional appraiser.
items.explanation: Past passive: 'was assessed'.

items.prompt: Professional ________ insurance protects doctors and lawyers against lawsuits.
items.explanation: Professional indemnity (or malpractice) insurance covers legal liability for professional errors.

items.prompt: All medical records ________ strictly confidential by the insurer.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'are kept'.

items.prompt: The ________ period is the time between the start of the policy and when coverage begins.
items.explanation: A waiting period is common in health and disability insurance.

items.prompt: The terms of the contract ________ clearly in the document.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'are stated'.

items.prompt: If a claim is ________, the policyholder can usually file an appeal.
items.explanation: 'Denied' is the formal term for rejecting a claim.

items.prompt: Cyber ________ insurance is becoming increasingly important for modern businesses.
items.explanation: Cyber liability insurance covers losses from data breaches and other cyber threats.

items.prompt: The annual report ________ to the board of directors next month.
items.explanation: Future passive: 'will be presented'.

items.prompt: A ________ is a person named in a life insurance policy to receive the death benefit.
items.explanation: The beneficiary receives the payout.

items.prompt: The application ________ due to incomplete information.
items.explanation: Past passive: 'was rejected'.

items.prompt: Maritime insurance ________ to cover risks related to shipping and transport by sea.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'is designed'.

items.prompt: The ________ is the amount the insurance company pays out for a covered loss.
items.explanation: Payout refers to the actual payment made on a claim.

items.prompt: Staff training ________ every six months to ensure compliance.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'is conducted'.

items.prompt: Travel insurance usually includes ________ for trip cancellations and medical emergencies.
items.explanation: Coverage refers to the protections included in the policy.

items.prompt: The customer ________ about the changes in the policy terms.
items.explanation: Past passive: 'was informed'.

items.prompt: An insurance ________ is a legal document that outlines the terms of the agreement.
items.explanation: The policy is the official contract.

items.prompt: The risks of natural disasters ________ by global climate patterns.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'are influenced' (plural).

items.prompt: A ________ sum is a one-time payment instead of a series of smaller payments.
items.explanation: A 'lump sum' is a common term for a single large payment.

items.prompt: The new legislation ________ by the parliament last week.
items.explanation: Past passive: 'was passed'.

items.prompt: ________ insurance covers damage to your own vehicle regardless of who is at fault.
items.explanation: Collision insurance covers damage to the insured's vehicle.

items.prompt: The files ________ to the cloud server every night.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'are uploaded' (plural).

items.prompt: A ________ of insurance is a document that proves you have active coverage.
items.explanation: A certificate of insurance is a standard proof of coverage.

items.prompt: The final decision ________ by the senior underwriter tomorrow.
items.explanation: Future passive: 'will be made'.

items.prompt: Group ________ insurance is a common benefit provided by employers.
items.explanation: Group health insurance is a standard employee benefit.

items.prompt: The insurance industry ________ as one of the most stable sectors in the economy.
items.explanation: Present passive: 'is regarded'.
